'''Granbull''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''グランブル''' ''Granbull'') is a {{type|Fairy}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation II]]. Prior to [[Generation VI]], it was a {{type|Normal}} Pokémon.

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Snubbull}} starting at [[level]] 23.

==Biology==
Granbull is a purple, bipedal, bulldog-like Pokémon. It has a prominent lower jaw with two long, fang-like growths. Its upper jaw has two small fangs. The jaws are so heavy that the Pokémon has trouble keeping its head up. On the sides of its head are flat, curved ears, and its small nose is black. There is a black collar around its neck with two small white markings on it. Around its wrists are two black band markings, and it has a short tail.

Despite its fierce appearance, it is actually very timid. Unless Granbull is startled, it will not bite indiscriminately. If attacked, it will flail about to fend off its attacker. Granbull wanders around {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Urban Pokémon|urban areas}}.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:Cassidy Granbull.png|thumb|250px|left|Granbull in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
=====[[Madame Muchmoney's Granbull]]=====
A female [[Madame Muchmoney's Granbull|Snubbull]] ran away from its home and followed {{TRT}} (and by extension, {{Ash}} and {{ashfr}}) around the [[Johto]] region for a short while. She evolved into Granbull in ''[[EP175|The Trouble with Snubbull]]'' and returned to her owner, [[Madame Muchmoney]].

=====Other=====
[[Cassidy]]'s Granbull debuted in ''[[DP065|Sleight of Sand!]]'', where it battled against [[Jessie's Seviper]]. In the midst of the battle, it was taken out by [[Dawn's Piplup]] and a wild {{DL|Recurring wild Pokémon in the anime|Hippopotas}}.

{{an|Dawn}} took on a {{pkmn|Coordinator}}, named [[Mario]], who used a Granbull during the {{to|Lilypad}} {{pkmn|Contest}} in ''[[DP146|Dressed for Jess Success!]]''. It was used against Dawn and {{TP|Dawn|Mamoswine}} but was soon defeated.

====Minor appearances====
A Granbull appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M03|Spell of the Unown: Entei]]'', under the ownership of a {{pkmn|Trainer}} named {{OBP|Lisa|M03}}.

Two Granbull were among the Pokémon competing in the [[Sumo Conference]] in ''[[EP194|Ring Masters]]''.

A Granbull appeared in ''[[EP228|Extreme Pokémon!]]'', where it was seen practicing and participating in the [[Extreme Pokémon Race]].

A Granbull appeared in ''[[XY127|Analysis Versus Passion!]]'', under the ownership of [[Remo]]. It was only seen on the scoreboard of his [[Lumiose Conference]] match with [[Alain]].

====Pokédex entries====
{{Animedexheader|Johto}}
{{Animedexbody|EP175|Granbull|Ash's Pokédex|Granbull, the Fairy Pokémon. The [[Evolution|evolved]] form of {{p|Snubbull}}. Granbull has extreme biting power due to its heavily muscled jaw and its strong teeth and tusks.}}
{{Animedexfooter/Pokémon|original|Johto}}

===In Pokémon Generations===
A Granbull appeared during a flashback in ''[[PG18|The Redemption]]'' as one of the many Pokémon fighting in the great war of [[Kalos]], 3,000 years previously. Two were later seen petrified after the [[ultimate weapon]] was used by [[AZ]] to end the war.

==In the manga==
[[File:Green Granbull Adventures.png|thumb|130px|Granbull in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Granbull appeared in ''[[PS101|Teddiursa's Picnic]]'', where it was stealing Pokémon to get attention as its jaw was dislocated. When {{adv|Gold}} accidentally knocks its jaw into relocation, it happily returns all the Pokémon it took.

In ''[[PS179|The Last Battle XIII]]'' a Granbull was one of the Pokémon sent to help the fight in [[Ilex Forest]].

{{adv|Green}}'s {{p|Snubbull}} evolved into Granbull in ''[[PS288|Give It Your Best, Blastoise]]''.

A Granbull appears with its Trainer at the Mini-game Corner in the {{chap|X & Y}}.

In ''[[PAXY39|Epilogue]]'', when [[Emma]] was part of the Lumiose Gang, a Granbull was seen under their ownership.

==In the TCG==

==Game data==
===NPC appearances===
* [[Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Red Rescue Team and Blue Rescue Team|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon]]: {{mdc|Granbull|1}} hangs around [[Pokémon Square]]. Granbull evolved from {{p|Snubbull}} without realizing what was happening, though it enjoyed its new appearance after getting over the initial shock. This event alerted the rest of the characters that evolution was now possible.

==Trivia==
* Granbull and its {{p|Snubbull|pre-evolution}} share their {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Clefairy}} and {{p|Clefable}}. They are all known as the Fairy Pokémon.
* As the Ability {{a|Quick Feet}} did not exist until [[Generation IV]], a Snubbull with either {{a|Intimidate}} or {{a|Run Away}} will always evolve into a Granbull with Intimidate in [[Generation III]] games.<!--If a Granbull with Intimidate that has second Ability flag is transferred to the Generation VI games, its Ability will become Quick Feet?--> This means that in Generation III, Granbull is the only Pokémon with an Ability that evolves from a Pokémon with one of two possible Abilities that shares to Granbull's Ability.
* Granbull is the first Pokémon to evolve on-screen in the Pokémon Mystery Dungeon series.

===Origin===
Granbull is based on a {{wp|bulldog}}. Its {{pkmn|category}} and {{t|Fairy|type}} may reference the {{wp|Cù Sìth}}, a mythological creature in {{wp|Celtic mythology}} whose name literally translates to "dog fairy".

====Name origin====
Granbull may be a combination of ''grand'' and ''bulldog'' or ''bully'' (referencing its tendency to scare foes with its fangs or even bite them). It may also reference ''grumble'' (referring to its grumbling, growling tendency).
